title: Tank Tear Item
body:
No name in mind yet. (Just thought of this idea today)

{{item:3070}} + {{item:3105}} + 550g = 2500 total. 

I'm not certain about the final price being correct for balance purposes, but I want the item to be affordable for supports

The passive does not increase the resistance stats in the same way that the other tear items increase damage stats. Instead, **AWE** diverts a percentage of post-mitigated damage received to the user's mana pool. This percentage increases based on the user's bonus mana. 

If the user has no mana resource, or runs out of mana, they receive full damage instead.

Edit:

I did have an alternative in mind, and it actually occured to me that I didn't take into account there being an evolved form of this once tear reached +750. 

I wanted to avoid stacking resistances before adding what amounts to damage resistance on top of it because I felt that would be unfair. 

Someone has already suggested making AWE stack health based on mana. The component items might be different in order to make this make sense, but it is possible. 

Then when the item evolves, it gains an active that diverts a portion of damage received to mana. Since this would be a temporary active effect with a cooldown, the percentage could be much larger. 

Edit 2: 
Archangle's Staff changes 'Mana Charge' so that it generates +8 mana instead of +4, upon mana expenditure.

Manamune changes 'Mana Charge' to +5 upon mana expenditure and basic attacks. 

I would make this item change 'Mana Charge" generate +8 upon mana expenditure while in combat with enemy champions or from spells that heal/shield/buff allied units (other than yourself), but still only +4 otherwise.

I was spit-balling an idea like this a couple weeks ago on some random thread, and had landed on mana getting converted to health.

I *like* the idea of mana being used to mitigate damage, but I think there's no way to make that balanced and feel good. If it's too strong, you just won't ever take full damage, and if it's too weak, you won't have any mana left for spells. That creates a bit of a balance issue imo.
Wasn't that singed's old passive?

Yeah, suppose it was.

I still like it as a finished item idea. Not sure it's as good as a champion passive. But now that Singed can't double down on it, might as well add it to an item, right?! :P

Not necessarily so? The best way is to just make the effect cheap so you can have it at a low % and thus not drain all the mana while still being well worth it and you should also probably include some active effect like {{item:3040}} which gives you a much bigger protection that uses your mana but is temporary

You could also solve it by making it a toggled effect (you can choose to burn all of your mana to gain durability or you can turn it off if using your abilities is more important and you are low on mana) or an effect that turns off when at low mana (like {{item:3042}} mana to damage only works when above 20% max mana)

Yeah, I could get behind those ideas, I suppose.

I would still rather have the stats, which I feel like is just better clarity for you and opponents and also has better counterplay. You can tell when an opponent has a huge health bar; little harder to account for damage reduction when you're trying to evaluate mid-combat.

Good point. I have made a few adjustments to the original post, and the overall concept. Making the damage redirection an active could help to allow the effect to be more powerful because the effect is gated by a duration and a cooldown. 

I think I would honestly like to see it have a long up-time, maybe it could be extended by remaining in combat, or in combat with enemy champions.

You could also use the solution {{item:3042}} uses in that it only works when above 20% max mana so it will pretty much always leave you with enough mana to use your abilities for a while

Binding a lot of the power to an active effect is also possible though at that point since the passive effect likely wouldn't be strong enough to ever drain your mana enough to matter you might as well make the active effect scale with your max mana rather than having it drain your mana

Or you could also just have it as toggled ability allowing the player to choose if they value durability or mana more (sometimes durability can be more useful/important than using your abilities)

The OP just describes the item without describing the need for it, and I don't think there is one. There are already enough tanky mana items. The whole reason Ryze has mana scaling is because he was considered a mid-range mage who needed to gain offensive stats while building defensive items, which often include mana.

I have actually found that getting too in depth with descriptions about why I think something should be done actually decreases the likelyhood of people reading the post. In fact, the edits I added to the post have put me over the point where I think posts should be, and since I did so I feel like the amount of comments and upvotes have decreased. I obviously can't prove that this is the specific reason why, but it seems to be a pattern based on my previous posts. The fact that it has already received upvotes has really helped in general though. 

As for the "need" for the item. .. I feel like it would be pretty arrogant of me to try and claim that the game is so broken without this item. Do I think it could be useful to some and maybe not to others? Absolutely. Is it essential to anyone? No. .. But along the same lines, why does the game need to have Iceborn Gauntlet and Frozen Heart, .. they are similar enough to one another. They offer very similar stats. They are certainly utilized in different ways by different champions, and the unique passives that they offer make them different enough to fit into a place within the game. The same can be said for many other items in the game when compared. So I don't think it is really a fair question or expectation for me to have a convincing answer to. 

I also hope that many people take posts like these as nothing more than ideas that are nearly impossible to have any sense of balance without extensive alpha and beta testing, which the average player simply can not do. The basic stats, recipe, gold cost and efficiency are easy enough to figure out, but all of the ways that those stats could impact the game is literally impossible for us to consider. 

Personally, I am throwing this idea out there in hopes that someone might help me to identify things that I might not have thought of, and if the community agrees with the concept enough to get some upvotes, .. then maybe it will get the attention of someone at Riot. Honestly, I would never expect that something I have suggested, and I have suggested many things, would make it into the game in any way that is 100% unmistakably derived from my suggestion, .. but what it all really comes down to is that the activity of thinking of things that might improve the game is fun for me. 

>Side note: As far as things that I suggested that might have been taken and added into the game goes. .. The only thing that I do remember suggesting before it hit the PBE was the way Kled and Skaarl's health was displayed separately in the health bar.  I obviously can't be sure that it was literally my post that fed the idea to Riot. It is entirely possible that they already had the idea or that it was someone else's post that they actually saw. If you would like to see the actual post, [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/P2tgAZjU-kled-healthbar-request) it is. 24 upvotes and 69 votes in my favor in the poll currently. This post was made a few days after he first hit the PBE and the health was displayed this way the day before he hit live servers.

You mentioned price and balance, we can give this an estimate based on gold efficiencies. Your item is about 100% gold efficient once fully stacked (2550/2500), not counting Awe Passive. That's not terrible but considering the work/wait that you have to go through it's probably not good enough. Looking at a similar item Archangel's is about 112% efficient by similar metrics (3580/3200). I would recommend dropping the price on it by about 200 gold to make it about 110% gold efficient.

Regarding the passive, I feel like HP or actual resistances would be better since generally if you build Tear you want mana for your spells, not to protect you. Also, keep in mind that Riot has been specifically pushing for mana regen to be the stat that supports build, not raw mana. For this reason this item would probably be more used on tanks, who tend to have some Mana issues but don't necessarily want AP or AD.

I like your Seeker's option. I would point out that Seeker's has 30 armor at base, but stacked to full capacity would actually put it at 45 armor. With this in mind, a player who purchased Seeker's before Tear could theoretically lose armor when they upgraded. I expect that this might have been a typo or an oversight on your part but it would need to be accounted for.

Someone actually brought it up last time I posted the idea. The 15 extra armor would come from the awe passive. It's not really feasible for it not to give at least 15 armor, because even assuming you are using a champion with really low base mana (Kalista has the lowest at 232 at lvl 1) and farm directly to get the item as fast as possible (without buying tear first and generating extra mana stacks), you should be high enough level for your base mana+250 from base item mana to give you 750 mana total, which is the point at which the passive gives 15 armor.

So to answer your question, I thought about it, but I honestly am not sure it's actually even possible. I didn't think it was worth hindering clarity to name the exception though. If it was technically possible I would anticipate adding a basic, undocumented check condition to make sure that it gave at least 45 armor. Good catch though!

Edit: Thought I should mention, that the reason I did it this way instead of just adding the +15 onto the base of the item is because I would have to nerf the Awe Passive ratio to keep the same overall value on its own. This in turn would actually result in an overall nerf, because this item would be fantastic when stacked with other mana items (ROA+IBG yes please), and nerfing the Awe passive would hurt that interaction.

I actually just looked into champion mana pools even more.

Kalista is not actually the worst case scenario here. Despite having the lowest base mana in the game, her respectable growth of +35 per level does her some favors.

Twisted Fate has the lowest base mana in the game at level 18 (656), and has the lowest mana growth as well (+19/level). In this niche case of TF not having manaflow, building a Seeker's, then building it straight into my item I would say that it is actually possible to lose armor in the exchange, because his base mana combined with tear base mana would not equal 750 until he a reached level 9! Once again, this is a pretty remote possibility, but it would probably be worth adding a undocumented condition to cover it.

 Fun fact though, if Galio or Fidd cheated the item in at level 1, they would still get the proper combined base armor value. With a base mana of 500 (highest int he game!), they would immediately upon building this have 750 mana and thus get the full 45 armor.
What tank needs that kind of mana? They cant even spam enough to have it stack

Tank supports

Or rather, supports who need to be "more tanky"
You know that {{item:3010}} would probably break this tank tear item right? You can't "divert dmg taken to mana" but also "damage taken becomes mana" at the same time.

Why not? 

So they work together. Most likely the actual balance would still result in the player losing health and mana, but their overall effectiveness would be greater, which is generally the point of sustain items. 

Why shouldn't items synergize with other items?

Because anyone who buys Rod of Ages would buy this item as their defensive item probably. So they'd get a ton of EHP and have a lot of mana from two items while still getting a solid chunk of damage.


I don't know if they can get a ratio that'd be good, especially since worse mana costs is what I imagine is how characters with sustain are able to be forced out of lane. 

EDIT: I do want to point out that I'm no balance expert, I'm just a bit wary that the synergy might make Rod of Ages users have too much tankiness for two items.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but Eternity doesn't affect how much damage is taken. So the effects aren't mutually exclusive.

The recursive stacking could be solved by giving both passives the same name.
